Im creating a rails app using devise, twitter bootstrap and gmaps4rails. Twitter bootstrap and gmaps need some tricks to work properly.
1)height 100% doesn't work. You need to use jquery to fix it 
$(window).bind("load resize", function(){
    var h = $(window).height(),
    offsetTop = 40;
    $('#map').css('height', (h - offsetTop));
});
Note the offset value depends on your css offset. My is defined in the bootstrap_and_overrides.css.less file as follow: 
body { padding-top: 40px; }
2)If the gmaps tooltip are not displayed correctly, add this line to your style.css file 
img {
  max-width: none;
}
